Description: Terracotta mould-made protome of a woman. Top of headdress fragment from Archaic style protome? White coating preserved in patches. Pale red-brown fabric with grey core. Abundant fine silver and gold mica, quartz and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Archaic East Greek protome of late Archaic date (broadly 550BC to 480BC). The fabric is similar to that of figurines of an East Greek origin. Often identified as ‘Rhodian’ though numerous production places are known across East Greece. Parallels from Lindos, Rhodes, of Type A1 dated ‘late Archaic’, after 525BC (Blinkenberg 1931, 591, pl.116, nos 2463 and 2465). A number of fragments from the same type of protome may come from the same piece (Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA452, NA761 and possibly NA831; Cambridge, Fitzwilliam Museum GR.8.1899; British Museum GR 2011,5009.275). Similar protomes were found on Samos (Tsakos 2007, 194, pl.26.2, third quarter of the 6th century BC) and from Olynthus (Robinson 1952, 73-4, pl.1-3, nos 1-2, 6th century BC). This type falls into Croissant's Aeolis and Clazomenae protome types, dated between 540 and 510 BC (Croissant 1983,164 nos 82-3 and 95-107, Types F4 and G3). For context, function and details on protome parallels and fragments from Naukratis see protome records from Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology (NA350, NA355, NA354, NA353, NA390, NA850, NA426, NA803 and NA509). Blinkenberg, C. 1931. Lindos. Fouilles de l’Acropole 1902-1914, I. Les petits objets, Berlin. Croissant, F. 1983. Les protomés féminines Archaïques: Recherches sur les représentations du visage dans la plastique Grecque de 550 à 480 av. J.-C. Ecole Française d'Athènes, Athens. Robinson, D. M. 1952. Olynthus XIV. Terracottas, lamps, and coins found in 1934 and 1938. Johns Hopkins University studies in archaeology. Baltimore, Johns Hopkins Press; London, Oxford University Press. Tsakos, K. 2007. Die stadt Samos in der geometrischen und archaischen epoche, in Corbet, J. Frühes Ionien : eine Bestandsaufnahme; Panionion-Symposion Güzelçamlı, 26. September - 1. Oktober 1999 Milesische Forschungen. sches Archäologisches Institut, Mainz, 189-200.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.069) (Phase 1)
